meanings.sent1: Tommy likes to tattle on his friends when they do something wrong.
meanings.sent2: It is not nice to tattle on others without a good reason.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Sarah couldn't resist the urge to tattle about the surprise gift.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to tattle the secrets of the forest as it whispered through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The little bird chirped happily, as if eager to tattle the latest news to anyone who would listen.

meanings.definition: A person who tells secrets or gossip
meanings.sent1: The tattle in our class always knows the latest news before anyone else.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to become known as the tattle in your group of friends.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was the tattle of the forest, spreading rumors among the animals.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a mysterious air, as if it held the secrets of every tattle who had lived there.
meanings.sent5: In the world of birds, the tattle is the one who spreads the most interesting stories among the flock.
